data.question: What is the empirical formula of compound 1?
Which compound contains a zigzag chain of edge-sharing triangulated dodecahedra?
What type of structure does compound 3 feature?
data.answer: A double-walled silver column constructed from the fusion of four different kinds of irregular polyhedra.

data.question: Is the empirical formula of compound 4 C32H19Ag12F50O29.5?
Does compound 5 contain a double cage with each single cage in the shape of a square antiprism?
What is the crystal system of compound 6?
Which compound was obtained with the presence of propionitrile in crystallization?
Is the C−C bond length in all known double salts and multiple salts of silver acetylide compatible with that of acetylene?
What promotes the aggregation of silver(I) centers according to the text?
data.answer: The d10−d10 closed-shell attraction known as argentophilicity.

data.question: Can Ag2C2 be dissolved in a concentrated aqueous solution of a soluble silver salt?
What is the role of AgBF4 in the synthesis of novel double salts of silver(I) acetylide?
data.answer: It acts as a 'silver(I) ion source' to promote the dissolution of Ag2C2.

data.question: Are the structures of the silver acetylide-containing systems unpredictable?
What influences the specific geometry of the silver cages and their interconnection into larger aggregates?
data.answer: The bulky hydrophobic tails of the perfluorocarboxylate anions and the terminally coordinated solvento ligands.

data.question: Does the addition of nitrile solvent in crystallization affect the resulting crystal structure?
What is the effect of replacing CH3CN with C2H5CN in the crystallization process?
data.answer: It does not affect the structural integrity of the 2D honeycomb structure in Ag2C2·AgF·4CF3SO3Ag·2L.

data.question: What is the largest double cage among the reported silver acetylide-containing systems?
data.answer: The hexadecanuclear double cage (C2)2@Ag16 in compound 5.

data.question: What type of structure is generated when no nitrile solvent is used in crystallization?
data.answer: A 3D network is generated via bridging carboxylates.

data.question: Is compound 3 the only known example of a silver acetylide-containing complex generated from the fusion of different kinds of C2@Agn cages?
What is the role of argentophilicity in the dissolution process of Ag2C2?
data.answer: It provides the driving force to transform Ag2C2 to some soluble [C2@Agn]^(n-2)+ species.

data.question: Does the presence of terminally coordinated solvento ligands influence the assembly of an acetylide-captivating silver cage?
